page.title: 16Homelife in Ballywalter
page.content: Many of the people in Ballywalter were born here and so were their relations. The women mainly work in the textile factory, as home helps or in shops. Farmers' wives often help their husbands by feeding calves, pigs or hens and cleaning dairy equipment. Many teenagers have no jobs so television is important and is for them to enjoy and be entertained by. It keeps them from hanging around the streets and pubs. Many people also have videos so they can hire films and then watch them if they have nothing to do. There are not so many stray dogs going around now because the council has dog-wardens going around lifting them in a white van.The licence is so dear that people cannot afford to keep them.
